intro: Acridocarpus austrocaledonicus, commonly known as the New Caledonia tamarind, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces edible pods that contain seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
